recommended_for.pre_test_information: Fasting for atleast 12 hours before the test is mandatory.
recommended_for.test_description: A lipid profile test is a crucial diagnostic tool used to assess the levels of various types of fats, or lipids, in your blood. This test provides a comprehensive evaluation of your cardiovascular health by measuring several key components: total cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, very-low-density lipoprotein (VLDL) cholesterol, and triglycerides. Each of these lipids plays a distinct role in your body's metabolic processes and has implications for your heart health.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: 12 hours fasting is required before the test. This means you are not supposed to consume food or any other fluids, except water.
recommended_for.test_description: Apolipoprotein A1 is the primary protein associated with high- density lipoprotein and Apolipoprotein B is the primary protein associated with low- density lipoprotein. The ratio of these two is relative to risk in cardiovascular diseases and coronary heart diseases.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The test helps in the diagnosis of Congestive heart failure. The concentration of BNP in the people suffering from congestive heart failure.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The C-Reactive Protein (CRP) test measures the concentration of CRP in the blood. CRP is a protein produced by the liver in response to inflammation, and its levels rise in the presence of acute or chronic inflammatory conditions. The quantitative CRP test provides a precise measurement of CRP levels, helping clinicians evaluate the degree of inflammation and monitor the progress of treatment.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: 12 hours fasting is required before the test. This means you are not supposed to consume food or any other fluids, except water.
recommended_for.test_description: It is a simple blood test, which helps check the levels of cholesterol. This test is important as early diagnoses of high cholesterol will help you manage it and make sure the levels remain normal.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test is conducted to differentiate the damage between skeletal muscle and heart muscle. It can also test for heart attack and monitors any additional heart damage.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: 12 hours fasting is required before the test. This means you are not supposed to consume food or any other fluids, except water.
recommended_for.test_description: HDL cholesterol is often referred to as ‘good’ cholesterol because it helps remove other forms of cholesterol from the bloodstream. This test measures the amount of HDL cholesterol in your blood, providing valuable information about your risk of heart disease.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: 12 hours fasting is required before the test. This means you are not supposed to consume food or any other fluids, except water.
recommended_for.test_description: An elevated concentration of Homocysteine is an independent risk factor for cardiovascular disease.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: One of the most acute phase reactant for inflammation is CRP (C Reactive Protein). Even a mild elevation of CRP has evolved as an indication of cardiovascular risk initially and myocardial infarction, recurrent coronary stroke or angina and congestive heart failure. HSCRP predicts increased cardiovascular risk among men and women. This evaluation helps to determine the risk of myocardial infarction among patients. It also assesses the risk of developing cardiovascular disease or ischemic events among individuals who do not manifest disease at present.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Elevated levels of Lipoprotein (a) increases the risk of cardiovascular diseases. Lipoprotein (a) provides information on patients who are suspected to be at high risk of Coronary Heart Disease, depending on various factors including stroke, hypertension, smoking, alcohol consumption, obesity, diabetes, etc.

recommended_for.test_name: NT-PRO BNP(N-TERMINAL PRO BRAIN NATRIURETIC PEPTIDE)
recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test helps to diagnose a suspected case of chronic heart failure. Mild form of cardiac dysfunction can also be detected by these tests.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: The patient is asked not to eat anything 8 to 14 hours before the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Triglycerides are the most common type of fat in the body. They store excess energy from your diet. A high triglyceride level combined with high LDL (bad) cholesterol or low HDL (good) cholesterol is linked with fatty buildups within the artery walls, which increases the risk of heart attack and stroke.

recommended_for.test_name: THYROID PROFILE (TOTAL T3, TOTAL T4, TSH)
recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: A Thyroid Profile test, which includes Total T3 (Triiodothyronine), Total T4 (Thyroxine), and TSH (Thyroid Stimulating Hormone), is an essential diagnostic tool to assess the function of the thyroid gland. The thyroid is a butterfly-shaped gland located in the neck, and it plays a critical role in regulating metabolism, energy levels, growth, and development. The hormones T3 and T4 produced by the thyroid regulate various body functions, while TSH is produced by the pituitary gland to stimulate the thyroid to produce T3 and T4.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test. Sample should be provided at the same time in follow-up cases.
recommended_for.test_description: The TSH Serum Test, or Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone Serum Test, is a blood test that measures the concentration of TSH in the bloodstream. TSH is produced by the pituitary gland and regulates the thyroid gland's production of thyroid hormones (T3 and T4). This test is a key indicator of thyroid function and helps assess whether the thyroid is working properly.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Thyroid peroxidase is an enzyme found in the thyroid gland and plays a major role in secretion of thyroid hormones. A TPO test is used to detect antibodies against TPO in the blood. This test helps in diagnosing thyroid auto- immune disorders and in deciding therapy for subclinical hypothyroidism.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: If the Anti TPO autoantibody comes out to be negative but the clinical suspicion of autoimmune thyroid disease is high then one needs to undergo an anti-Tg autoantibody measurement. By detecting these antibodies in the case of neonatal hypothyroidism, the transplacental antibody transfer can be determined. This is useful especially if there is a maternal history of autoimmune thyroiditis.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: The sample should be collected after 6 weeks of thyroidectomy, needle biopsy or administering of I131 therapy.
recommended_for.test_description: The test is used as a follow up after thyroidectomy in the patients suffering fromthyroid cancers. It helps in knowing the metastasis of cancer to the lymph nodes. Increased level of Tg levels indicates recurrent or persistent disease.

packages.description: Liver tests help evaluate liver health and detect conditions such as fatty liver, hepatitis, infections, and liver damage at an early stage. Regular testing supports timely treatment and prevents serious complications.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The Liver Function Test (LFT) is a valuable diagnostic tool for assessing liver health and diagnosing various liver conditions. By measuring key enzymes, proteins, and substances in the blood, the LFT provides critical insights into liver function and helps monitor disease progression or treatment efficacy. Regular testing and consultation with healthcare professionals are essential for managing liver health and preventing severe complications.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures bile acid levels in the blood to assess liver function and detect liver disorders, bile flow problems, or liver damage at an early stage.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures ALT enzyme levels in the blood to assess liver health and detect liver inflammation or damage.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures albumin levels in the blood to assess liver and kidney function and overall nutritional status.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures ALP enzyme levels in the blood to evaluate liver, bile duct, and bone health.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: A bilirubin test is used if a child or an adult is showing symptoms of jaundice. This might include dark urine, yellowing of skin and eyes, loss of appetite, nausea, etc. The test is performed on a new-born baby as the part of standard medical care. The test is also prescribed if a person is suffering from hemolytic anaemia.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures total bilirubin levels in the blood to assess liver function and detect jaundice or bile flow problems.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: 12 hours fasting is required before the test. This means you are not supposed to consume food or any other fluids, except water.
recommended_for.test_description: This test is ordered when you show the symptoms of Wilson's disease. It is a rare genetic condition, which leads to the accumulation of too much copper in the liver, brain, and other tissues and organs.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures GGT enzyme levels in the blood to assess liver and bile duct health and detect liver damage.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: In this test, the transudates show low total protein concentrations and may be caused due to cardiac failure. Also, the exudates show the high total protein concentrations which might be caused due to traumatic or inflammatory conditions.

packages.description: Lung tests help evaluate respiratory health and detect infections, allergies, and lung-related conditions that affect breathing and oxygen levels.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The CBC test is a comprehensive tool that measures the levels of various blood components and offers essential data regarding your general health. The CBC is highly significant, serving as a crucial tool for monitoring health. The stresses of modern life and diverse population health conditions often necessitates CBC test, whether experiencing unusual fatigue, frequent infections, or managing an ongoing health condition, a CBC test can be vital in your healthcare journey.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Culture and sensitivity tests are conducted to look for germs, which includes bacteria and fungus, that can be the source of an infection. It also identifies the best course of treatment for the said illness or infection.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The test is performed when a patient suffers from periodic or persistent skin, lung or digestive symptoms which point towards allergies. It is also used if a healthcare provider believes there might be a parasitic infection.

packages.description: Infertility tests help identify hormonal, reproductive, or biological factors affecting the ability to conceive and support timely diagnosis and treatment planning.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test is used to diagnose and do follow- up check-ups on women with symptoms of polycystic ovarian syndrome and other disorders involving excessive androgen. This assay is also used to diagnose anorexia nervosa and monitor sex steroid and anti- androgen therapy.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Anti-Müllerian Hormone (AMH) serves as a vital biomarker for assessing reproductive health and fertility potential in women. This hormone, produced in the granulosa cells of ovarian follicles, serves as an indicator of ovarian reserve and potential fertility. The test involves a simple blood draw, and it provides essential data on a woman's reproductive lifespan and fertility potential.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test is performed to determine the ovulating hypogonadism and oligomenorrhea in the women. The test examines the status of the ovary and is used to find the follicle development during IVF. In the males, the test is used to evaluate feminization such as Gynecomastia. The precocious and delayed puberty in the women can also be assessed by this test. It can also be used to monitor dosage of the female hormone replacement therapy along with anti-estrogen therapy in the post menopausal women.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: For women, the recommended day for this test would be Day 2 / Day 3 of the menstrual cycle.
recommended_for.test_description: The test is pretty useful in evaluating the menstrual irregularities and can be used to determine conditions such as hypogonadism, ovulation and helps in detecting infertility along with the pituitary disorders.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures LH levels to assess reproductive health, ovulation, and hormonal balance in men and women.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The test is used to determine if the ovulation happened during a menstrual cycle or not. This helps in evaluating placental function during pregnancy and can also be used to diagnose adrenal or testicular tumours in a patient.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Overnight fasting is preferred. Sample to be collected 4 hours after waking up in the morning.
recommended_for.test_description: The test can be used to evaluate pituitary tumours along with amenorrhea, galactorrhea, infertility and hypogonadism. It can also be used in monitoring therapy in prolactin producing tumours.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The test is used for evaluating men who show symptoms of hypogonadism such as loss of libido, erectile dysfunction, gynecomastia and infertility. In the case of boys, the test can be used to evaluate the irregular onset of puberty. This test is also useful in monitoring anti-androgen therapy in prostate cancer, precocious puberty and male to female transgender disorders. The test is also helpful in evaluating infants who have ambiguous genitalia or virilization. Diagnosis of androgen secreting tumours can also be detected with the help of this test.

packages.description: Kidney tests help evaluate kidney function and detect problems such as infections, stones, or kidney damage at an early stage.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: 12 hours fasting is required before the test. This means you are not supposed to consume food or any other fluids, except water.
recommended_for.test_description: The Glucose Fasting Test is a critical diagnostic tool used to determine the level of glucose in the blood after an 8-10 hour fast. This test helps in diagnosing diabetes and pre-diabetes and is essential for monitoring blood sugar levels in individuals undergoing treatment for diabetes.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Sample of early morning urine is required.
recommended_for.test_description: A complete urine examination (CUE) is a fundamental component of routine health screenings and holds paramount importance in maintaining overall well-being. It aids in the early detection and management of various health conditions, ensuring timely intervention and treatment.
test_includes: Centrifuged Sediment Wet Mount and Microscopy

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Sample to be collected 2 hours post meal.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures blood sugar levels two hours after a meal to evaluate how well the body controls glucose and to detect diabetes.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Fasting for 8 to 12 hours prior to the test is recommended.
recommended_for.test_description: The Renal Profile, also known as the Kidney Function Test (RFT/KFT), is a comprehensive diagnostic tool used to assess how well the kidneys are working. This test typically includes a panel of blood and urine tests designed to evaluate kidney function and detect potential abnormalities.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Vitamin D is a fat-soluble vitamin that is crucial for several physiological functions in the body. Its primary role includes regulating calcium and phosphorus absorption, which are essential for maintaining healthy bones and teeth. Beyond skeletal health, vitamin D also supports immune function, cardiovascular health, and muscle function. Research has increasingly linked adequate vitamin D levels to reduced risks of chronic diseases such as diabetes, hypertension, and certain cancers.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures albumin levels in the blood to assess liver and kidney function and overall nutritional status.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Overnight fasting is preferred.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures beta-2 microglobulin levels in the blood to assess kidney function and detect certain immune system or blood-related disorders.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures calcium levels in the blood to assess bone health, kidney function, and overall metabolic balance.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Electrolytes contain chloride and it works with potassium, sodium, CO2 and other substances to keep the proper balance of body fluids. It also maintains the acid-base balance in the body. A chloride test is used to find any abnormality in the concentration of chloride in the body.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The Serum Creatinine Test is a critical tool for assessing kidney function by measuring creatinine levels in the blood. Creatinine is a waste product generated from muscle metabolism. Normally, the kidneys filter creatinine out of the blood and excrete it in urine. Elevated levels of creatinine in the blood can indicate impaired kidney function, as the kidneys are not effectively filtering waste products.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The Random Blood Glucose Test is a simple and effective way to measure your blood sugar levels at any given time. It provides a snapshot of your current glucose levels and can help you understand how your body responds to different foods, activities, and medications.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test is used to manage patients with Diabetes mellitus and help them in delaying or avoiding the onset of kidney related diseases. This test is a better indicator than isolated microalbumin levels in urine because of inherent day to day variability in albumin excretion.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The test is performed to find the level of phosphorus in the blood. It also helps in diagnosing conditions which lead to an abnormal level of phosphorus.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Potassium is one of the most important minerals involved in cell functions. It helps in maintaining the water and electrolyte balance in the body. The test measures the amount of potassium present in the bloodstream.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Sodium is particularly important for nerve and muscle function. A sodium blood routine test or serum sodium test, allows your doctor to monitor how much sodium is in your blood.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: A Urea serum test is useful in determining how well your kidneys are functioning. It is done by measuring the amount of urea nitrogen in the blood. High levels of urea nitrogen in the blood is a sign of kidney or liver problems.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Uric Acid- Serum test measures the levels of uric acid you have in your blood. This test can aid in diagnosing whether you have medical issues such as gout or kidney stones.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: The patient is asked not to eat anything on the night before the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Vitamin D 1,25 Dihydroxy (Calcitriol) is biologically active form of Vitamin D, normally made in Kidney. Its main action is to collectively increase calcium in the body and modulate the skeleton. Its measurement is intended for workup of assessment of hypercalcemia and assessment of vitamin D in patients with renal failure.

packages.description: General tests help evaluate general function and detect problems such as infections, stones, or kidney damage at an early stage.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The CBC test is a comprehensive tool that measures the levels of various blood components and offers essential data regarding your general health. The CBC is highly significant, serving as a crucial tool for monitoring health. The stresses of modern life and diverse population health conditions often necessitates CBC test, whether experiencing unusual fatigue, frequent infections, or managing an ongoing health condition, a CBC test can be vital in your healthcare journey.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: 12 hours fasting is required before the test. This means you are not supposed to consume food or any other fluids, except water.
recommended_for.test_description: The Glucose Fasting Test is a critical diagnostic tool used to determine the level of glucose in the blood after an 8-10 hour fast. This test helps in diagnosing diabetes and pre-diabetes and is essential for monitoring blood sugar levels in individuals undergoing treatment for diabetes.

recommended_for.test_name: THYROID PROFILE (TOTAL T3, TOTAL T4, TSH)
recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: A Thyroid Profile test, which includes Total T3 (Triiodothyronine), Total T4 (Thyroxine), and TSH (Thyroid Stimulating Hormone), is an essential diagnostic tool to assess the function of the thyroid gland. The thyroid is a butterfly-shaped gland located in the neck, and it plays a critical role in regulating metabolism, energy levels, growth, and development. The hormones T3 and T4 produced by the thyroid regulate various body functions, while TSH is produced by the pituitary gland to stimulate the thyroid to produce T3 and T4. This test helps in diagnosing thyroid disorders, such as hyperthyroidism, hypothyroidism, and thyroid dysfunction, and is often used to monitor the effectiveness of thyroid hormone replacement therapy.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The HbA1c test, also known as glycated or glycosylated haemoglobin test, is a crucial diagnostic tool used to monitor and manage diabetes. It measures the percentage of glucose that has bound to haemoglobin in the blood over a period of 2-3 months. This test is invaluable as it provides a comprehensive view of blood sugar control, reflecting long-term glucose levels rather than short-term fluctuations.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test. Sample should be provided at the same time in follow-up cases.
recommended_for.test_description: The TSH Serum Test, or Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone Serum Test, is a blood test that measures the concentration of TSH in the bloodstream. TSH is produced by the pituitary gland and regulates the thyroid gland's production of thyroid hormones (T3 and T4). This test is a key indicator of thyroid function and helps assess whether the thyroid is working properly.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Sample of early morning urine is required.
recommended_for.test_description: A complete urine examination (CUE) is a fundamental component of routine health screenings and holds paramount importance in maintaining overall well-being. It aids in the early detection and management of various health conditions, ensuring timely intervention and treatment.
test_includes: Centrifuged Sediment Wet Mount and Microscopy

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Sample to be collected 2 hours post meal.
recommended_for.test_description: The Postprandial Glucose Test, also known as the post-meal glucose test, is a diagnostic procedure used to measure the level of glucose in the blood after a meal. This test is particularly valuable for assessing how the body processes carbohydrates and manages blood sugar levels, especially in individuals with diabetes or those at risk of developing the condition.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Fasting for atleast 12 hours before the test is mandatory.
recommended_for.test_description: A lipid profile test is a crucial diagnostic tool used to assess the levels of various types of fats, or lipids, in your blood. This test provides a comprehensive evaluation of your cardiovascular health by measuring several key components: total cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, very-low-density lipoprotein (VLDL) cholesterol, and triglycerides. Each of these lipids plays a distinct role in your body's metabolic processes and has implications for your heart health.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The Liver Function Test (LFT) is a valuable diagnostic tool for assessing liver health and diagnosing various liver conditions. By measuring key enzymes, proteins, and substances in the blood, the LFT provides critical insights into liver function and helps monitor disease progression or treatment efficacy. Regular testing and consultation with healthcare professionals are essential for managing liver health and preventing severe complications.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Fasting for 8 to 12 hours prior to the test is recommended.
recommended_for.test_description: The Renal Profile, also known as the Kidney Function Test (RFT/KFT), is a comprehensive diagnostic tool used to assess how well the kidneys are working. This test typically includes a panel of blood and urine tests designed to evaluate kidney function and detect potential abnormalities.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The urine culture and sensitivity test is a valuable diagnostic tool for identifying the cause of UTIs and guiding effective treatment. By determining the specific bacteria or fungi responsible for the infection and identifying the appropriate antibiotics, this test helps healthcare providers manage and treat UTIs efficiently, reducing the risk of complications and promoting faster recovery.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Vitamin D is a fat-soluble vitamin that is crucial for several physiological functions in the body. Its primary role includes regulating calcium and phosphorus absorption, which are essential for maintaining healthy bones and teeth. Beyond skeletal health, vitamin D also supports immune function, cardiovascular health, and muscle function. Research has increasingly linked adequate vitamin D levels to reduced risks of chronic diseases such as diabetes, hypertension, and certain cancers.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: 12 hours fasting is required before the test. This means you are not supposed to consume food or any other fluids, except water.
recommended_for.test_description: Vitamin B12, also known as cobalamin, is a crucial nutrient for the body's health. It is essential for DNA synthesis, red blood cell production, and neurological function. A deficiency in Vitamin B12 can lead to a range of health problems, including irreversible nerve damage, poor red blood cell production, and cognitive decline. Regular monitoring of Vitamin B12 levels is important to prevent these complications.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: T3 and T4 are high protein bound hormones which are affected by various genetic and other factors which somehow have influence on protein binding. This test is useful in measuring the free or unbound hormone levels which correspond to the biologically available hormone pool.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: The Liver Function Test (LFT) with GGT is a comprehensive diagnostic tool used to assess the health and function of the liver. This test typically includes a panel of blood tests designed to evaluate liver function and detect potential abnormalities.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: A Urine glucose (fasting) test is one of the most important tests used to monitor the level of blood glucose (high or low) in the body.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: The sample must be collected exactly 2 hours after starting the meal.
recommended_for.test_description: This test helps determine if the glucose levels in the urine are extremely high.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Thyroid peroxidase is an enzyme found in the thyroid gland and plays a major role in secretion of thyroid hormones. A TPO test is used to detect antibodies against TPO in the blood. This test helps in diagnosing thyroid auto- immune disorders and in deciding therapy for subclinical hypothyroidism.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: A random urine glucose test is used to detect the presence of glucose in the urine at any time of the day.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: Neonatal liver function tests are a group of blood tests used to evaluate the health and function of the liver in newborn infants. These tests help detect liver problems that may be present at birth or develop shortly after birth.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: Overnight fasting is mandatory.
recommended_for.test_description: The test is used as a diagnostic test for the deficiency of precursor or active form of Vitamin B12. It can identify deficiency in early stages and thus helps in initiation of treatment early. IVitamin B12 deficiency may lead to pernicious anemia or Anemia

recommended_for.pre_test_information: The patient is asked to avoid eating anything for 12 hours. The sample is wrapped in aluminium foil to protect it from light.
recommended_for.test_description: The test is used to determine the deficiency of the vitamin B1. The vitamin helps in the metabolism of carbohydrates and amino acids. Deficiency of Vitamin B1 causes a disease called Beri-beri.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: The patient is asked to avoid eating anything for 12 hours. The sample is wrapped in aluminium foil to protect it from light.
recommended_for.test_description: The test is used for determining the people suffering from motor and sensory disorders. It helps in knowing the levels of Vitamin E in premature infants.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: 12 hours fasting is required before the test. This means you are not supposed to consume food or any other fluids, except water.
recommended_for.test_description: The hemogram test, also known as HMG or Complete Hemogram Test, is a comprehensive set of tests including CBC and ESR that help assess overall health and detect a variety of illnesses. This test is particularly useful in diagnosing anemia, infections, and leukemia, among other conditions.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test is used to diagnose and do follow- up check-ups on women with symptoms of polycystic ovarian syndrome and other disorders involving excessive androgen. This assay is also used to diagnose anorexia nervosa and monitor sex steroid and anti- androgen therapy.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test measures bile acid levels in the blood to assess liver function and detect bile flow problems or liver disorders.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: It is a blood test, which is conducted to identify syphilis, which is an STD or a sexually transmitted disease.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: This test is used to detect fungal infections, particularly invasive aspergillosis and candidiasis, by measuring levels of beta-D-glucan in the blood.
test_includes: CENTRIFUGED SEDIMENT WET MOUNT AND MICROSCOPY

recommended_for.test_description: This test is used to detect fungal infections, particularly invasive aspergillosis and candidiasis, by measuring levels of beta-D-glucan in the blood.

The 17-ketosteroids are derived from the adrenal cortex and testes. It is found in the urine and are metabolites of adrenal and gonadal androgenic steroids. 60-70% of it are produced by cortex in the case of men and in women the adrenal cortex is responsible for 100% production. It is useful in evaluating gonadal and adrenal disorders.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: An early morning specimen is preferred.
recommended_for.test_description: 17 OHP along with Cortisol and Androstenedione constitutes the best screening test for Congenital adrenal hyperplasia caused by either 11 or 21 hydroxylase deficiency. It is also useful to evaluate females with hirsutism and infertility.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.
recommended_for.test_description: 5-Fluorouracil (5Fu) chemotherapy is the most preferred treatment for advanced gastric cancer (GC). 5 Fu assay helps assess the recovery of platelets, RBC, WBC in order to determine single lineage or multiple lineage effects. It also helps detect compounds that protect cells against chemotherapeutic agents.

5-HIAA is an important metabolite of Serotonin and is found in urine. Usually, 1-3% of dietary Tryptophan is metabolized to serotonin. However, if a patient is suffering from Intestinal Carcinoid Syndrome it can be up to 60%

recommended_for.test_description: haemoglobin is the protein p IgMent in the RBCs which is responsible for transporting oxygen to the tissues and organs. Genetic mutations can cause the body to produce abnormalities in the haemoglobin and hence, the abnormal haemoglobin can cause too little oxygen to reach your tissues and organs. A haemoglobin electrophoresis test is a blood test used to measure and identify the various kinds of haemoglobin in the bloodstream.

recommended_for.pre_test_information: No special preparation is required for the test.

recommended_for.description: Type 2 diabetes is a chronic condition where the body becomes resistant to insulin or doesn't produce enough insulin, leading to high blood sugar levels. Over time, this can result in serious health complications, such as heart disease, nerve damage, kidney issues, and vision problems. Unlike type 1 diabetes, which is autoimmune, type 2 is often linked to lifestyle factors like obesity, inactivity, and poor diet, although genetics also play a role. Managing type 2 diabetes typically involves lifestyle changes, such as diet and exercise, and sometimes medication or insulin therapy.

test_included.test_description: Diabetes is a chronic, metabolic disease characterized by elevated levels of blood glucose (or blood sugar), which leads over time to serious damage to the heart, blood vessels, eyes, kidneys and nerves. The most common is type 2 diabetes, usually in adults, which occurs when the body becomes resistant to insulin or does not make enough insulin. Incidence: Prevalence of Diabetes is almost 9.3% between the age group of 18 – 69. Type 2 diabetes contributes to 90% of the overall Diabetes affected population (Source: National NCD monitoring survey 2018)

recommended_for.description: Cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) encompass a range of conditions affecting the heart and blood vessels, including coronary artery disease, heart attack, stroke, heart failure, and hypertension. These diseases are the leading cause of death globally. The primary causes of CVDs include unhealthy lifestyle choices such as poor diet, lack of physical activity, smoking, and excessive alcohol consumption. Other significant risk factors are high blood pressure, high cholesterol, diabetes, obesity, and genetic predisposition. Symptoms of cardiovascular diseases can vary depending on the specific condition but may include chest pain, shortness of breath, fatigue, irregular heartbeats, and swelling in the legs and feet. Preventative measures include adopting a heart-healthy diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins, engaging in regular physical activity, maintaining a healthy weight, avoiding tobacco products, and managing stress. Regular health check-ups and monitoring of blood pressure, cholesterol levels, and blood sugar levels are also crucial for early detection and management of cardiovascular diseases. Taking these steps can significantly reduce the risk of developing CVDs and improve overall heart health.

test_included.test_description:
Cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) are a group of disorders of the heart and blood vessels. Blood flow to the heart, brain or body can be reduced because of a blood clot (thrombosis) or build-up of fatty deposits inside an artery, leading to the artery hardening and narrowing (atherosclerosis). The most important behavioral risk factors of heart disease and stroke are unhealthy diet, physical inactivity, tobacco use and harmful use of alcohol.

Incidence: Prevalence of CVDs is 29.4% for adults of age 45 and above (Source: Clinical Epidemiology and Global Health Volume 13)

Cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) are a group of disorders of the heart and blood vessels. Blood flow to the heart, brain or body can be reduced because of a blood clot (thrombosis) or build-up of fatty deposits inside an artery, leading to the artery hardening and narrowing (atherosclerosis). The most important behavioral risk factors of heart disease and stroke are unhealthy diet, physical inactivity, tobacco use and harmful use of alcohol.

Incidence: Prevalence of CVDs is 29.4% for adults of age 45 and above (Source: Clinical Epidemiology and Global Health Volume 13)

recommended_for.description: Hypertension, commonly known as high blood pressure, is a chronic medical condition where the force of blood against the artery walls is consistently too high. This persistent elevation in pressure can damage blood vessels over time, increasing the risk of serious health problems such as heart attack, stroke, kidney disease, and heart failure. Hypertension often develops gradually and may not present with noticeable symptoms in its early stages, making regular blood pressure monitoring essential for early detection. Lifestyle factors play a significant role in the development of hypertension, including a diet high in sodium, lack of physical activity, obesity, excessive alcohol consumption, and smoking. Other contributing factors include age, genetics, and certain medical conditions. Management of hypertension typically involves a combination of lifestyle modifications, such as adopting a heart-healthy diet, maintaining a healthy weight, regular exercise, and limiting sodium intake, along with medication when necessary. Early diagnosis and consistent management can help control blood pressure levels and reduce the risk of complications.

test_included.test_description:
High blood pressure (hypertension) can quietly damage the body for years before symptoms develop. Uncontrolled high blood pressure can lead to disability, a poor quality of life, or even a deadly heart attack or stroke.

Incidence: One in four adults in India suffers from hypertension and only 10% of patients have their blood pressure under control, according to a report by the India Council for Medical Research.

test_sample: Centrifuged Sediment Wet Mount and Microscopy

test_includes.test_name: ESTIMATED GLOMERULAR FILTRATION RATE (EGFR) WITH CREATININE (2)

recommended_for.description: Gut health refers to the balance and function of the microorganisms living in your digestive tract, collectively known as the gut microbiota. This complex ecosystem, comprising bacteria, viruses, fungi, and other microbes, plays a crucial role in overall health beyond digestion. A healthy gut microbiota aids in breaking down food, absorbing nutrients, producing essential vitamins, and supporting immune function. Imbalances in gut health, often caused by poor diet, stress, antibiotic use, or illness, can lead to various digestive issues such as bloating, gas, constipation, and diarrhea. Furthermore, gut health is increasingly linked to broader health outcomes, including mental well-being, skin health, and chronic disease risk. Maintaining a balanced gut microbiome through a fiber-rich diet, probiotics, and lifestyle adjustments can promote digestive regularity and support overall health.

test_included.test_description: Good gut health occurs when you have a balance between the good (helpful) and bad (potentially harmful) bacteria and yeast in your digestive system. Poor nutrition, stress and long term use of antibiotics can affect the gut health. Poor gut health can affect immune function, hormone levels, weight and can cause various diseases. Most common diseases associated with gut health are Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) and Small Intestinal Bacterial Outgrowth (SIBO).

recommended_for.description: Bone health is essential for overall well-being and mobility. Healthy bones provide structure, protect organs, anchor muscles, and store calcium. Maintaining bone health throughout life is crucial to prevent conditions like osteoporosis, a disease where bones become weak and brittle, increasing the risk of fractures. Key factors that contribute to bone health include adequate intake of calcium and vitamin D, regular weight-bearing and muscle-strengthening exercises, and healthy lifestyle choices such as not smoking and limiting alcohol consumption. Calcium-rich foods like dairy products, leafy green vegetables, and fortified foods, along with sensible sun exposure or supplements for vitamin D, are vital for bone maintenance. Regular physical activity, especially activities like walking, running, and resistance training, helps build and preserve bone density. Additionally, avoiding smoking and excessive alcohol can further protect bone health. Taking proactive steps to maintain bone health can lead to a stronger, more resilient body, reducing the risk of bone-related issues as we age.

test_included.test_description:
Bone health is affected by a number of factors like Calcium, Physical activity, Tobacco or alcohol use, gender, obesity, family history, hormone levels, easting disorders and can be also due to some medications.

Incidence: Osteoporosis is the most common disease affecting bone and Indian population has 18.3% of such cases. Female are at slightly higher risk than males. (Source: IJORO)

recommended_for.description: Alcohol consumption refers to the drinking of beverages containing ethanol, commonly known as alcohol. While moderate drinking can be part of social and cultural activities, excessive alcohol consumption poses serious health risks. Excessive drinking includes binge drinking, heavy drinking, and any drinking by pregnant women or individuals under the legal drinking age. Alcohol affects every organ in the body, primarily the brain, liver, heart, and pancreas. It can lead to the development of chronic diseases such as liver cirrhosis, pancreatitis, cardiovascular diseases, and various cancers, including those of the liver, mouth, throat, esophagus, and breast. Additionally, excessive alcohol consumption can weaken the immune system, making the body more susceptible to infections. It can also impair judgment and coordination, increasing the risk of accidents and injuries.

test_included.test_description: Excessive alcohol use can lead to the development of chronic diseases and other serious problems including High blood pressure, heart disease, stroke, liver disease, weakening of the immune system, dementia and mental health problems, including depression and anxiety. Incidence: Alcohol use is about 23% to 74% in male and about 24% to 48% in females (Source: National Health Portal of India)

test_sample: Centrifuged Sediment Wet Mount and Microscopy

recommended_for.description: Cancer is a group of diseases characterized by the uncontrolled growth and spread of abnormal cells. These cells can invade surrounding tissues and spread to other parts of the body through the bloodstream or lymphatic system. Cancer can affect any part of the body, including the lungs, breasts, colon, prostate, and skin. Common risk factors include smoking, excessive alcohol consumption, obesity, radiation exposure, and certain viral infections. Early detection and treatment are crucial for effective cancer management. Treatment options may include surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, and targeted therapy. Preventive measures include maintaining a healthy lifestyle, regular screenings, and avoiding risk factors.

test_included.test_description: Cancer is a disease in which some of the body’s cells grow uncontrollably and spread to other parts of the body. It is a is a genetic disease caused by changes to genes that control the way our cells function, especially how they grow and divide. There are more than 100 types of cancer and it is the second-leading cause of death in the world.Incidence: The cancer burden of India is 26.7 million and is expected to increase to 29.8 million by 2025 (Source: National Cancer Registry Program 2021)

Cancer screening is a process of identifying and diagnosing cancer at an early stage, before it has spread to other parts of the body. This can help to prevent cancer from developing and can improve the chances of successful treatment. Cancer screening can be done through a variety of methods, including physical exams, blood tests, and imaging tests. It is important to note that cancer screening is not a substitute for regular medical checkups and should be used in conjunction with other screening methods.

recommended_for.description: Depression is a mental health disorder characterized by persistent feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and a lack of interest in activities once enjoyed. It can significantly impact daily functioning and overall well-being. Common symptoms include persistent sadness, loss of interest in activities, fatigue, difficulty concentrating, insomnia or excessive sleep, appetite changes, and thoughts of suicide. Treatment options may include medication, psychotherapy, lifestyle changes, and support groups. Preventive measures include maintaining a healthy lifestyle, practicing stress-reduction techniques, and seeking professional help when needed.

test_included.test_description: Depression is a mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest and is also called major depressive disorder or clinical depression. It affects how you feel, think and behave and can lead to a variety of emotional and physical problems.Incidence: National Mental Health Survey revealed that nearly 15% Indian adults need active intervention for one or more mental health issues and one in 20 Indians suffers from depression

recommended_for.description: Nutrition disorders are conditions caused by an imbalance in nutrient intake, including undernutrition, overnutrition, and vitamin or mineral deficiencies, which can affect overall health and body functions.

test_included.test_description: Nutritional deficiencies occur when a person’s nutrient intake consistently falls below the recommended requirement. Nutritional deficiencies can lead to a variety of health problems. Most of the nutritional deficiency diseases are caused by lack of protein vitamins, minerals, carbohydrates and fats. Incidence: 35.5% Indian Children and 18.7% women suffer from malnutrition (Source: National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5)

recommended_for.description: Obesity is a medical condition characterized by excessive body fat that can negatively impact health. It's typically measured using body mass index (BMI), with a BMI of 30 or higher considered obese. Obesity increases the risk of numerous health problems, including heart disease, type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure, stroke, and certain cancers. It often results from a combination of factors, such as poor diet, lack of physical activity, genetics, and hormonal influences. Effective treatment typically involves lifestyle changes like improved diet, increased physical activity, and, in some cases, medications or surgery.

test_included.test_description: Obesity is a complex disease involving an excessive amount of body fat. Obesity is not just a cosmetic concern. It is a medical problem that increases the risk of other diseases and health problems, such as heart disease, diabetes, high blood pressure and certain cancers. Incidence: As per National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5) data, one in four people in India are overweight.

test_sample: Centrifuged Sediment Wet Mount and Microscopy

recommended_for.description: Respiratory conditions affect the lungs and airways, making breathing difficult. Common respiratory disorders include asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), bronchitis, and pneumonia. These conditions can lead to symptoms such as shortness of breath, coughing, wheezing, and chest tightness. Respiratory illnesses may be caused by infections, smoking, allergens, or chronic lung diseases. Testing for respiratory conditions often includes a pulmonary function test (PFT), which measures lung capacity and airflow, and spirometry, which checks for conditions like asthma or COPD.

test_included.test_description: Pollution impact tests help assess how exposure to environmental pollutants affects your health. These tests can detect early signs of damage to organs like the lungs, heart, and kidneys, and identify inflammation or oxidative stress caused by pollution. Regular monitoring can help you understand your risk levels and take preventive measures to protect your health.

recommended_for.description: Sexual wellness encompasses physical, emotional, and psychological well-being related to sexual health. It involves healthy relationships, safe sexual practices, and addressing concerns like low libido, erectile dysfunction, or hormonal imbalances. Testing for sexual wellness may include hormone level checks, STD screening, and fertility assessments to ensure optimal sexual health and function.

test_included.test_description: Sexual wellness encompasses physical, emotional, and psychological well-being related to sexual health. It involves healthy relationships, safe sexual practices, and addressing concerns like low libido, erectile dysfunction, or hormonal imbalances. Testing for sexual wellness may include hormone level checks, STD screening, and fertility assessments to ensure optimal sexual health and function.

test_sample: Centrifuged Sediment Wet Mount and Microscopy

test_included.test_description: Sexual wellness tests are essential for men's health, helping identify potential issues like erectile dysfunction, infertility, and prostate problems. These tests can detect hormonal imbalances, inflammation, and oxidative stress, providing insights into overall sexual health and well-being. Regular monitoring can help you understand your risk levels and take preventive measures to protect your health.

recommended_for.description: Sleep disorders are conditions that affect the quality, timing, and duration of sleep, leading to impaired daytime functioning. Common sleep disorders include insomnia (difficulty falling or staying asleep), sleep apnea (interrupted breathing during sleep), restless legs syndrome (uncomfortable sensations in the legs), and narcolepsy (excessive daytime sleepiness). Blood tests may also be used to rule out conditions like thyroid problems or nutrient deficiencies affecting sleep.

test_included.test_description: Sleep disorders involve problems with the quality, timing, and amount of sleep, which result in daytime distress and impairment in functioning. The cumulative effects of sleep loss and sleep disorders have been associated with a wide range of deleterious health consequences including an increased risk of hypertension, diabetes, obesity, depression, heart attack, and stroke.Incidence: 5.4% Indian Population in age group 30-69 are at severe risk of sleep disorders (Source: Lancet Study on Sleep and Sleep disorders)
